alert.note: Alert for Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:09PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Oneida County through 900 PM EDT... At 809 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Floyd, or 7 miles east of Rome, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Utica, Rome, Deerfield, Floyd, Whitesboro, New York Mills, Yorkville, Oriskany, Holland Patent and Stittville. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 near 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
